elements.title: cabinet cups (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that porcelain cabinet cups were especially lavish pieces (example pictured) intended to be displayed in a china cabinet rather than used?

elements.title: Indiana Woodward (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that during her early career, ballerina Indiana Woodward danced the lead role in La Sylphide, replacing an injured dancer?

elements.title: recording studio (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Guns N' Roses debut studio album Appetite for Destruction was recorded at a recording studio founded by 1970s pop duo Captain & Tennille?

elements.title: National Centre for Immunisation Research and Surveillance (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a 1997 whooping cough outbreak in part led to the establishment of the National Centre for Immunisation Research and Surveillance in Australia?

elements.title: Jacob Wohl (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Jacob Wohl was banned for life by the National Futures Association when he was only 19 years old?

elements.title: Myanmar Coast Guard (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Myanmar Coast Guard was initially proposed as a civilian law enforcement agency before being established as a branch of the military three years later?

elements.title: Mattea Conforti (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after watching Matilda the Musical, Mattea Conforti complained that she could have starred in the title role?

elements.title: Tramp nightclub (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Keith Moon was briefly banned from the Tramp nightclub for destroying a chandelier?
